data.title: BeiGene Non-GAAP EPS of $1.95 beats by $0.65, revenue of $1.5B beats by $50M
data.description:
• BeiGene press release (ONC): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.95 beats by $0.65.
  • Revenue of $1.5B (+36.4% Y/Y) beats by $50M.

data.title: ACI Worldwide GAAP EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.18, revenue of $1.76B beats by $1.29B
data.description:
• ACI Worldwide press release (ACIW): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.18.
  • Revenue of $1.76B (+288.5% Y/Y) beats by $1.29B.
  • "For the full year of 2026, we expect revenue growth to be in the 7% to 9% range on a constant currency basis, or in the range of $1.88 billion to $1.91 billion. We expect adjusted EBITDA to be in the range of $530 million to $550 million. For Q1 2026, we expect revenue to be between $405 million and $415 million and adjusted EBITDA of $88 million to $93 million." the company said.

data.title: Primo Water Non-GAAP EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.06, revenue of $1.55B beats by $40M
data.description:
• Primo Water press release (PRMB): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.06.
  • Revenue of $1.55B (+10.7% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
  • Net sales increased 11.2% to $1.6 billion compared to $1.4 billion primarily driven by the inclusion of net sales attributable to Primo Water for the entire 2025 period due to the merger transaction, partially offset by a decrease in sales attributable to the sale of the production facility in Ontario, Canada in the first quarter of 2025.
  •

data.title: Millicom International Cellular S.A. reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Millicom International Cellular S.A. press release (TIGO): Q4 Net profit attributable to company owners $252 million
  • Revenue of $1.65B (+15.4% Y/Y) beats by $110M.
  •

data.title: Sopra Steria Group SA GAAP EPS of €15.23, revenue of €5.64B
data.description:
• Sopra Steria Group SA press release (SPSAF): FY GAAP EPS of $15.23.
  • Revenue of €5.64B.

data.title: Getlink SE reports FY results
data.description:
• Getlink SE press release (GRPTF): FY Revenue of €1.59B.
    • EBITDA: €859 million (+4% vs 2024), exceeding the top end of the guidance for 2025.
    • Cash position at €1,498 million at 31 December 2025.
    • Consolidated net profit of €320 million, up 3%.
    • Proposed dividend of €0.80 per share, vs €0.58 per share in 2024.

data.title: London Stock Exchange reports FY results
data.description:
• London Stock Exchange press release (LDNXF): FY Non-GAAP EPS of £420.6.
  • Total income up 5.5% to £9.35B
  • Organic constant currency growth in total income excluding recoveries of 6.5-7.5% including an acceleration in our subscription businesses’ organic growth
  • An improvement in constant currency EBITDA margin of 80-100 basis points
  • Capex intensity of c 9.5% of total income excluding recoveries
  • Equity free cash flow of at least £2.7 billion, based on foreign exchange rates of £1 = $1.32 and €1.17
  • Underlying effective tax rate of 24-25%

data.title: Münchener Rückversicherungs-Gesellschaft Aktiengesellschaft in München reports FY results
data.description:
• Münchener Rückversicherungs-Gesellschaft Aktiengesellschaft in München press release (MURGY): FY Net result for 2025 financial year of €6.1bn, outperforms guidance by €0.1bn
  • Dividend: Subject to approval by the Annual General Meeting, the dividend will increase to €24 per share
  • New share buy-back with a higher volume of €2.25bn to be completed by 2027 Annual General Meeting
  • Outlook: Net result for 2026 expected to rise to €6.3bn.
  • "2025 was a pivotal year for Munich Re. With a net result of €6.1bn, we not only set a new record, but also delivered on all the promises we had made as part of our five-year Ambition 2025 strategy programme. In times of crisis, our business model has proven to be resilient, growth-driven and profitable. Munich Re has consistently seized market opportunities as well as increased earnings while also stabilising them. This has allowed us to fully live up to the expectations of all stakeholders: our shareholders, customers, employees and society at large. Our new Ambition 2030 strategy programme will see us further diversify our business portfolio, expand the range of products and services we offer, and advance Munich Re as it evolves into a group that offers reinsurance, specialty insurance, and primary insurance at scale." said Christoph Jurecka Chair of the Board of Management.

data.title: Washington Post lost over $100M in 2025 - report
data.description:
The Washington Post, owned by Amazon (AMZN) founder Jeff Bezos, lost over $100M last year, people familiar with the matter told The Wall Street Journal.

The Post reportedly lost about $100M in 2024 and $77M in 2023. Its financial woes were the primary reason behind the layoffs of one-third of its workforce, which eliminated its sports section and many foreign bureaus.

Jeff D'Onofrio, the Post's acting publisher and CEO, and its executive editor Matt Murray held a staff meeting on Wednesday to discuss the 148-year-old paper's financial condition and productivity.

D'Onofrio told staff that expenses exceeded revenue between 2022 and 2025 as the Post hired hundreds of staffers in the prior years. 

He added that the number of news stories published by the paper fell 42% since 2020, while newsroom costs were up 16% in 2025 compared with 2020.

"We don’t want or need to do every story or jump on everything that happens," said Murray. "We're not a paper of record; there's no such thing anymore in today's world."

data.title: EPR Properties raises dividend by 5% to $0.31
data.description:
• EPR Properties (EPR) declares $0.31/share monthly dividend, 5.1% increase from prior dividend of $0.29.
  • Forward yield 6.38%
  • Payable April 15; for shareholders of record March 21; ex-div March 21.
  • See EPR Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.
